page.title: 03LANDSCAPE: CUMMOCK VALLEY-3
page.content:
Man has left his mark on the landscape. In the middle and lower valley are the scars of mining and remains of the railway lines which serviced the collieries. There are also some ruins of miners housing and one 'row' still inhabited.
In the upper valley the spread of the Forestry Commission's Kyle Forest - a mass of conifers - is a major feature. When the opencast site below Benbain has been restored it too will be planted.
Grey drystone walls and wire fences bordering the road or separating parcels of land also catch the eye.
